name: tap water production, direct filtration treatment | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12078/documentation

This dataset is created as a child of global dataset with edited production volume for this geography. ;;This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of direct filtration treatment for production of tap water. Direct filtration treatment includes sand filtration and disinfection. Inventory was constructed from reported chemicals, energy inputs and wastes from 2 distinct direct filtration plants located in Québec covering nearly 100% of total production of tap water from this technology.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - tap water production and supply, CH, 2000 - 2000 (3a700e71-708f-4021-873e-0a20b29460ad)]

From the intake pumping of raw surface water into the water treatment plant. 

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping, treatment system, lighting and heating of the building as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. It includes all chemicals and material added to the water during treatment and, when needed, ultraviolent lamps for replacement. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network which is included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from data from two plants in Quebec (Canada).The uncertainty was adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From two direct filtration tap water production facilities in Quebec (Canada) to global average of same technology. The uncertainty has been changed accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data collected from two direct filtration treatment plants in  Quebec (Canada). See corresponding Quebec dataset for more information. Note that percent representativeness is not supplied because technology-specific global production volumes is too uncertain. Should this information become available, the representativeness can be calculated by dividing the sum of the water treated by the Quebec plants that served as a basis for the Global dataset by the technology-specific global production volume. (5.73E11 kg/a)
